resources.string: Note: Use the reset button below or restart the app to clear all settings.

This example uses the Google in-app review instead of the library dialog. Debug is enabled. (note: this example doesn\'t work at the moment because the example app hasn\'t been uploaded to the Google Play Store)
This example uses custom config for set all setting of review dialog at once.
This example has no customizations. Debug is enabled.
In this example the default icon (app icon) has been replaced with a cusom icon. Debug is enabled.
This example uses a configured mail feedback dialog. Rate below the threshold to check it out.Debug is enabled.
This example uses the custom feedback dialog instead of the mail feedback dialog. Debug is enabled.
In this example the show never button will be displayed. Debug is enabled.
In this example the show never button will be displayed after three times. This means you have to click the later button for at least 3 times (other examples included). Debug is enabled.

In this example debug is disabled. The dialog will show on the third click. If the \"Later\" button has been clicked, the dialog will show again after 5 more clicks. You can also use the \"Never\" button. \nAttention: If you have already clicked the never button or the feedback button of another example, this dialog will not show up until you click \"reset\" or restart the app.
In this example the rating threshold was set to 4.5. So you need to rate at least 4.5 stars to see the store rating dialog. Debug is enabled.
In this example full star rating is enabled. So you can\'t set half stars in the rating dialog. Debug is enabled.
In this example the default texts has been replaced with dummy texts. Debug is enabled.
In this example the dialog is cancelable. A dialogCancelListener was set to show a toast. Debug is enabled.
In this example the dialog is used with a custom theme. Debug is enabled.
This button opens a new activity (ComponentActivity) to showcase the Jetpack Compose support.

This is a Jetpack Compose example with a ComponentActivity. So the button below only starts the Google in-app review. If you want to use the libraries dialog with Jetpack Compose your activity has to extend from FragmentActivity (e.g. ComponentActivity).
This is an additional message, which is hidden by default.
The answer to life, the universe and everything is 42.
I am so blue I\'m greener than purple.
All settings got cleared. Have fun!
